website_summaries.verdict: A budget model - suitable mostly for inflating jobs rather than air power tools.
pros: Perfectly adequate for a wide range of inflating jobs
should be able to drive some tools with low pressure requirements
cons: The hose is brittle and prone to fracture
However, that's a relatively cheap item to replace

customer_reviews.title: Good Entry Level Compressor for the Home Shop
customer_reviews.text: Good entry level compressor for small jobs like topping off car tires. The tank holds the charge with no leaks. You can shut off the tool hose so you can swap attachments. It recharges in a couple of minutes. The motor is loud, however. The hose is cheap but does work. It is what you would expect at this price point. It has an air blower/jet attachment which is very handy. You won't have to buy anymore canned air. You probably should be looking at a higher end air compressor if you expect to use air powered tools. All in all a good addition to my home shop.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Air Compressor for what it is intended!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent air compressor for small jobs. I use it for inflating and air brushing. I could not be happier with this. Price and shipping outstanding, very well packaged. Thank you Amazon! I see other reviews complaining how this air compressor doesn't do this and that . This air compressor has a great price for what it is intended. If you want an air compressor for air tools and painting get one with much higher cfm and be prepared to spend quite a bit more money. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Tjackson

customer_reviews.title: Junk lasted barely nine months.
customer_reviews.text: Received in March, December it won't build pressure anymore or even move any air. Occasionally used to air up tires and blow out PC cases, not exactly demanding work. Honestly if you want something that isn't going to last long at all buy something much cheaper at Harbor Freight and ignore this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: will

customer_reviews.title: This compressor takes 6 minutes to fill up to 110 ...
customer_reviews.text: This compressor takes 6 minutes to fill up to 110 psi. I tried to top off the air pressure in my tires from 25 to 32 pounds - it took over 30 minutes because the tank would drop to 30 pounds almost instantly and I would have to wait 5 minutes for it to fill back up to finish each tire. I bought it because it had the Campbell Hausfield name, now I will not buy anything from them ever again.
customer_reviews.author: MIke St. Amand

customer_reviews.title: Good Little Compressor.
customer_reviews.text: It takes a little longer to build up pressure to full than I think it should since it's only a 3 gallon, but overall it's a good little compressor. I bought it for airing up tires on the truck and trailer when I'm on the road since not all gas stations have air anymore. My 2500 watt inverter runs it just fine. If you're looking for something to run air tools, this is not the compressor for you, but it will air up tires to 85 psi with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: bob merchant

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as described
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item based on my good experience with a smaller, portable version of the same brand, which was excellent and consistently exceeded my expectations (I lent it to someone who stole it or lost it). This compressor does not work for car tires, and it does not provide sufficient pressure or delivery for ten-speed bicycle tires. It does not perform either of the services I purchased it for.
customer_reviews.author: MA Toal

customer_reviews.title: This thing SUCKS!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst air compressor I've ever encountered. It's obnoxiously loud for about 5 to 10 minutes. Finally reached 110 psi n shoots it's load in less than a minute to restart the compressing progress. Who's bright idea was this thing? There's no possible way work can actually get accomplished with this thing. If you get this, be prepared to only be able to blow up balloons, but not to many and not in any type of hurry.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: HEH NAH, HORRIBLE PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I messed up, I didnt read the reviews. I seen the name and the price and was like YES. I opened it, went together ok, kinda cheap assesories but whatever. I turned it on and waited, and waited, and waited... it took like 7 to 10 minutes to fill up. Painful... I started dusting out my PC and bam it was gone, not even 15 seconds of air at 40psi. Then I waited and waited and waited till it filled up again. Immediately I put it back in the box and it's on it's way back. Thank Goodness Amazon is so cool about returning it. I have never ever seen an air compressor this horrible ever.
customer_reviews.author: Tmac Boi

customer_reviews.title: Just fine at this price point!
customer_reviews.text: I am fully satisfied with this compressor at its price point. I purchased it just for filling tires, but wanted a compressor that would go to higher PSI than small portable ones. Yes, it's loud-but no louder than the 1.5 gallon Craftsman compressor I keep in my RV. Yes, it takes a while to fill the tank. But-it's a $79 compressor and it is just what one should expect. I think many of the reviewers expected a $300 compressor for $79. That's just not going to happen!
customer_reviews.author: RETIRED EXECUTIVE

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Compressor would not not pump/compress air right out of the box. Very shoddy workmanship. Thought this brand name item would be decent quality. What a rip off! Absolutely NOT worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: DAVID PRITCHARD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for him and his hobbies
customer_reviews.text: The garage is full of his tools and his prize car so finding room for another addition like a compressor meant it had to fit but also capable of delivering the pressure to handle his air tools. So far he is very happy as the unit is small enough to fit on one of the shelves and powerful enough to do the various work. He says he likes the regulator for making adjustments and the noise level is tolerable in close spaces. The addition of the tool kit also was a plus as he didn't have to purchase any add on's except a longer hose
customer_reviews.author: Minxy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: I like it a lot so far
customer_reviews.text: I like it a lot so far! I have not had it long, and will rarely use it. But for the price, it seems like a fantastic deal. It fills tires very quickly. It worked great with my pin/staple gun. The only complaint I could have is the hose. I can not stand the curly hose. It is too hard to manipulate and you just end up sliding the air compressor around if you actually attempt to extend the hose to its max length. I recommend buying a better hose to go with this.
customer_reviews.author: SamHain

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FOR DIYERS OR SMALLER TOOL PROJECTS.
customer_reviews.text: I expect noise, no biggie for me, except when I don’t expect it. 😉. It works like a dream for a DIY’er like myself. I have used it to operate my nailer, and aired up a tire with it. The nozzle changes was easy. I plan to buy another to give as a Christmas gift. If I can carry it anyone can. I have MS and have no problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna

customer_reviews.title: Great for filling tires
customer_reviews.text: I got this specifically for filling tires on my car, motorcycle, and bicycle. It's been great for this. Its relatively small reservoir may make it impractical for something like a paint sprayer, but it is perfect for filling up tires. It is pretty loud while it is filling up, but once it has reached capacity, I can top off tires on all vehicles without having the compressor come on again. It's really a great investment for me, as I like to make sure that my tires are within specs, especially on the motorcycle.
customer_reviews.author: R. Kosh

customer_reviews.title: Useles
customer_reviews.text: This thing is useles, I had to let it build up over and over just to put air I'm my car tire
customer_reviews.author: ta1953

customer_reviews.title: Product does not work and Amazon does not give sufficient return time for a product such as this!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is not even worth one star, but the system requires a star to be clicked. The air compressor could not get up to required compression and would not turn off. I don't always need to use an air compressor, so when I did use it, turns out I am a few days past the time to return. Not right! A lesson to be learned is NOT to buy things like this on line from Amazon! Buy from a reputable store that you can return a defective item to. Amazon is definitely NOT one of these places. Extremely disappointed in Amazon. Maybe someone will take the time to read this from Amazon and make this right!!
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: The loudest underperforming compressor I've ever seen
customer_reviews.text: It's advertised for 110 psi. That confuses me. Wide open the valve as far as it can go in the plus direction it takes me 10 minutes to reinflate a car tire from mid 20 psi to 35psi. It takes longer for my SUV. It's good for balls but that's it. Maybe 60psi max! Its way too expensive and loud for this low performance. I would never buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn&Jacob

customer_reviews.title: I like to thank campbell housfeld
customer_reviews.text: I like to thank campbell housfeld, buying this thing made me realize I a cheap person you get what you pay for, this thing is junk, dont buy stay away, you will regret it, yea it does the job, if you have the hours, it will not work for what you need it, its so loud the noise makes my family angry. 120 decibels loud, no one can stand that, you cant do any with that amount of noise, much less do the nail gun thing the advert says. if you want to look like a fool in front of your family and friends get this. also , over 10 min charge time.
customer_reviews.author: El chambombo

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: I purchased for my son who doesn't live here as a Christmas in July present. His brother did not take it to him until last weekend when he went to visit. My son brought it back Sunday evening (8/2/20) and told me it did not work. I plugged it in this morning and went to the manual to see if my son did something wrong. I went by the manual etc. I runs but when I hook up a hose there is no air coming out of the air outlet. I went to the Amazon site and saw it was out of return date as of 8/1/20. Help please.
customer_reviews.author: The Pro From Dover

customer_reviews.title: Don't do it
customer_reviews.text: It is loud, won't hold passed 40 psi , barely fills a tire with air . Don't buy ...
customer_reviews.author: Britini Jones

customer_reviews.title: It is Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: The Compressor was very small and dosen't hold alot of air. Two blasts from the air gun and that's all you get and have to wait 15 mins for it to fill up again. Don't believe it could be used for anything but to air up tires or inflatable mats or toys. Must say I was very disappointed. Wouldn't reccomend it to anyone. Too bad I waited to long to return it, had to buy another compressor and it was half the price of this one. Not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Listed as 120psi only fills to 60psi and runs constantly ...
customer_reviews.text: Listed as 120psi only fills to 60psi and runs constantly. Junk . Will have to buy a new replacement. Do not waist your money.
customer_reviews.author: John J Healey

customer_reviews.title: Does not function to capacity!  Malfunctions after little use!
customer_reviews.text: Does not function to capacity! I've only used it 3 times and it takes forever to build pressure, not the 3 minutes as advertised! I got the feeling someone returned this and I ended up with it. I bought one exactly like one before and after a few years the sleeve around the piston wore out. I only used it sparingly to blow up the my motorcycle tire at the beginning of the riding season. Poor product. Stops functioning after lettle usage.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly Loud
customer_reviews.text: This sounds like a jack hammer breaking up a sidewalk when it's running. I bought it to replace one that was stolen and of a comparable size. I didn't pay attention to the decibel level when looking for a replacement. I just talked to H-C technical support who said the noise level is normal for this model, at around 90 decibels. OSHA requires hearing protection starting below that level, in an industrial environment. If you can handle the noise go ahead and buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: BiblioAnnie

customer_reviews.title: Bone rattling noise
customer_reviews.text: Ok.... so by the reviews, I knew it would be loud, but, my word it is a kind of loud that hits you right in the bones! Turn it on in the driveway, hear it in the back of the house, in the bathroom, in the shower, with the water running! Turn it on late at night and the neighbors might complain. Yes it is THAT loud. However, it works fine for what I need, cleaning out my RC trucks after muddy or dusty bashing. Also gonna build a box to put around it to dampen the insane volume.
customer_reviews.author: Jaqleen

customer_reviews.title: It looks good but that's about it
customer_reviews.text: It looks good but that's about it. Takes about 10 minutes to get up to pressure while being so loud the neighbors are looking around. With the "air gun" attached I get maybe 15 seconds of air before the pressure drops and back again for several minutes of very loud pressure building. Absolutely cannot use this thing. Sorry I bought it.......too heavy to return. Amazon wanted to charge $40 bucks return fee. do I have any recourse ?
customer_reviews.author: JOHN J.

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 4 months!!
customer_reviews.text: I used this compressor about once a week for 10 minutes for blowing grass off my garden tractor. After about 4 months it started taking longer and longer to pump up, then finally it would run, but not pump up the tank at all! Handy little machine, but don't expect much for longevity. I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Dean H.

customer_reviews.title: This unit has failed me last year. I rarely ...
customer_reviews.text: This unit has failed me last year. I rarely used it, but when I fired up last year, it leaks somewhere but can not find out where, and I can not get it to fill the tank above 20lbs. It takes 10 min to get to 20lbs. I was able to use it to fill my lawn tractor tire 2 weeks ago, but today it would not get any pressure..no obvious leaks I can feel. I guess I should have paid more and got the Cable Porter!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry L Phillippe

customer_reviews.title: It worth geting for small job it nosie yes
customer_reviews.text: Yes i got these air compressor for blowing out electronic compones i know alot of ppl go oh just use can air ummm 18 dallor or more for not even geting a full cleaning umm yeah no thanks but it diffinly nosies as can be they shloud fix that but it still dose the job just fine keeps my pc and otheres runing longer
customer_reviews.author: kevin patton

customer_reviews.title: Incomplete and damaged.
customer_reviews.text: I cut the tape on the box, opened it, and as disgusted. The gauge for the compressor outlet had no lens (I could touch the needle). Worse, it came with NO ACCESSORIES! No hoses, fittings, instructions, paperwork, anything! I literally just got the compressor! I didn't even plug it in to see if it ran. I was so pissed off. Zero stars, and someone from Amazon better be getting ahold of me to make it right!
customer_reviews.author: Steve B.

customer_reviews.title: Missing critical part!
customer_reviews.text: The "inflation adapter" (between the blow gun & the inflation needles) was missing from the kit. Otherwise, the air compressor is ideal for what I need it for. Hopefully the company will read this and made things right! UPDATED REVIEW: The company representative informed me that this part had been discontinued but a replacement part was available and should have been included is my kit. She was very responsive to my emails!
customer_reviews.author: Brian-n-Shana

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to trim windows and doors. It worked great. It came with everything I needed to connect to my nail gun. The instructions are clear. The noise level is tolerable. It’s light and easy to move around. I’m an older woman who has no experience with tools. If I can use this, anybody can.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl J.Top Contributor: Nail Polish

customer_reviews.title: It kinda works
customer_reviews.text: This thing is not much more then a slow tire inflater very slow and extremely loud spend the money for a good one before you buy this one I mean it works and will run my 400 watt power inverter in my truck and has saved me a time or 2 hauling cars and is very light but I don't think id but another one
customer_reviews.author: thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Not too noisy, perfect for tire inflation and other uses. Great size for storing in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: PaulaT

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Great little air compressor! Does as advertisements state. Perfect for little jobs around the house. If your looking to run air tools you might want to look at another larger compressor. But small paint guns and die grinders ,tire inflater ...perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Sam Robbins

customer_reviews.title: Noisy
customer_reviews.text: I've had small portable air compressors before but not this brand. I thought it was extremely loud, took too long to build pressure and the small coil hose was plastic and didn't fully extend. It stayed coiled on a 50 degree day. I'm going to spend more and get the B&D pancake compressor.
customer_reviews.author: TG

customer_reviews.title: Even too loud with ear plugs!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely loud, to the point of having to leave the room and the motor has to run excessively long to fill the tank. Have to wonder how it is even legal. The coiled air hose it too tightly formed to be of any use. Might as well just be a short piece of hose. Had I not left it sitting in the box for months before trying it I would have sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cornelius

customer_reviews.title: Superior tire inflator
customer_reviews.text: I'll never go back to a traditional tankless tire inflator. Super fast. I have a honda civic and I can comfortably top off my tires with a single tank. I'd definitely want something bigger if I had a truck or if I was regularly inflating tires from zero psi.
customer_reviews.author: John Greth

customer_reviews.title: Very loud air compressor
customer_reviews.text: My Goodness is this thing LOUD, the hose it came with its extremely stiff and hard to twist in, had to purchase a separate one, takes a really long time to fill up and while being so loud that the dogs for two blocks start barking like crazy til I turn this thing off? No way! I purchased this because it was a bit cheaper than some of the ones I saw listed, I regret, you might do well considering other compressors if you don't want issues with your neighbors.
customer_reviews.author: Leon

customer_reviews.title: Good Air Compressor
customer_reviews.text: I was needing to keep a lawnmower tire and a tire on my pickup pumped up. This works well! Is it noisy? Have you ever used a decent compressor that isn't noisy? Works well, good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory K. Brown

customer_reviews.title: the pressure system worked great. Auto shut off was reached at 110psi just ...
customer_reviews.text: First time power tool user... Realized a Brad nailer needed this, after buying the nailer! For my small woodwork project, I followed the break in instructions on this per the manual. Used the hose that came with it (found it difficult to screw it in).. the pressure system worked great. Auto shut off was reached at 110psi just as indicated in the box. After my use - 80psi, I had to release the pressure valve to empty the tank.
customer_reviews.author: sanimej

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small jobs
customer_reviews.text: Very portable and easy to use. The noise level is what you would expect for an air compressor of that size. The capacity is suitable for the simple tasks I am using it for, some may need a larger model for other more advanced jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Newman F Bowden

customer_reviews.title: Great air compressor, gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Best price you will find for an air compressor not only that you get a great package and can’t go wrong with the size. Won’t be taking up the space like other air compressors.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Hubbard

customer_reviews.title: Great little compressor
customer_reviews.text: I use this extremely portable compressor to keep the tires in my truck at proper pressure. I also use it when I wash my bicycle to blow it dry which makes my task so much easier. I have definitely found this product fulfills my needs well worth the price highly recommenced.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for a small machine.
customer_reviews.text: Only have used it once but it worked well. Used it to blow water from a waterline. Probably would have purchased a bigger one if I could go back in time, so it would be useful for more things. For a small job this one is good though.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for...it works.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is extremely loud and takes a long time for the tank to fill, once it's filled it takes not time at all to empty it. This isn't going to be good for anything more than small tires on bikes and ATVs. Could also be used to blow off small objects, but like I said it runs out of pressure pretty quick. The attachments it came with work fine, I would recommend buying an extra few connectors and a different air hose.
customer_reviews.author: Mark LeRoy Moore II

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Terrible unit, would only go to 60 lbs of pressure after 20 minutes. Very loud. Called company they said unit defective and will send a replacement, never happened.
customer_reviews.author: Ira Sonsky

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last 3 years!
customer_reviews.text: Not happy bought this June 14th, 2015 went out yesterday (April 25th, 2018) went to turn it on NOTHING. Has power but nothing happens. An air compressor should last more than almost 3 years. Used it a couple of times to put trim up and then to air up tires. Oh and it is LOUD!!! Won't buy another one from Campbell Hausfeld first time shame on you won't be a shame on me.
customer_reviews.author: Toonie

customer_reviews.title: Tight Hose
customer_reviews.text: Unit is compact and easy to use. I like the easy to see gauges. I really dislike the coiled air hose as it does not stretch easily. Hope hose will loosen up over time.
customer_reviews.author: drmorrison

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: This product works as expected, and it does the job well. It also has the added benefit of fitting under most truck toolboxes. I, however, bought it during a bit of bourbon-fueled shopping. So do not buy it unless you are sober because otherwise, you won't know what to do with it....Anyway, I got a compressor!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Good for Household Utility and Great Customer Service!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these for small jobs around the house, mainly filling tires and rafts, tubes, etc. Works well. One of the units wouldn't not power on after about 11 months and a few uses. Contacted manufacturer under warranty and customer service was exceptional. Had a new, replacement in 4 business days.
customer_reviews.author: Jim J.

customer_reviews.title: Get Some Earplugs
customer_reviews.text: I have used other air compressors in the past that were sort of loud, but this one takes the cake. It's extremely loud, and I was using it outside. I can't imagine what it would have been like if I had to use it indoors. Spend a little more money and get one that won't cause you to lose your hearing.
customer_reviews.author: NW Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great liitle compressor
customer_reviews.text: Just needed one for the garage and this works great for airing up car tires and blowing stuff off. Lightweight and very useful, max psi is 110!
customer_reviews.author: Big Joe

customer_reviews.title: this is basically one of those pocket emergency compressors that ...
customer_reviews.text: this is basically one of those pocket emergency compressors that take 5 minutes to raise your tire by 2 psi, attached to a 3 gal tank. Do yourself a favor and get one of the $100 models from another brand (pancake ones). This thing takes about 5 minutes to fill up and about 15 seconds to empty at 40psi to the outlet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Total made in China cr_ _ .
customer_reviews.text: This little compressor was a real piece of you know what. Cheap and poorly built. This little compressor broke in less than a year. I will never buy Campbell Housefield anything ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Walthers

customer_reviews.title: Cheap garbage product. This one seems to be same
customer_reviews.text: Bought in 2014 - crapped out this week. Just stopped working. Heard it happening slowly. Last one I bought I returned in less than 30 days. Cheap garbage product. This one seems to be same. My last one prior was also a Campbell Hausfeld......never worked correctly from initial receipt - limped with it for 4 years and that crapped out. Not sure I would buy a Campbell Hausfeld compressor again.......they just don't last long....
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Great home hobby system.
customer_reviews.text: First of all, for those with complaints, look at the price. What did you expect? I bought this with a realistic mind frame to use around the house. I am an avid carpenter and own a few air nailers. Works perfectly, even with my framing nailer. Is it loud .... yes, does it recycle frequently? .... yes. BUT IT WAS CHEAP !!!! and it works perfectly. If it only last a couple of years it was worth it. Plus, it's so light it's easy to grab along with your tool box and move from room to room. I'm thinking of buying another to keep in my work van.
customer_reviews.author: Krons

customer_reviews.title: it works great. Having two pressure gauges (one for the tank
customer_reviews.text: It's as loud as a jet engine when it's pumping up the reservoir tank. I always put in earplugs before turning it on, and I wouldn't want to be near it (IE; using it continuously) for very long. Aside from that, it works great. Having two pressure gauges (one for the tank, one to control the outlet pressure, is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: D. Magraw

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: The hose on this air compressor is coiled and extremely stiff. It is very difficult to use. My husband who has had one shoulder replacement and arthritis in the other finds it difficult to pull the hose to the tire. Thinking about returning it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wegienka

customer_reviews.title: it will last ~ 2 years w/ intermittent use
customer_reviews.text: Its inexpensive so if you want something that will only last a few years, this is a great choice. It worked well until it didn't.
customer_reviews.author: El Swift

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what we needed, yes it’s loud but it’s also a compressor- so it’s hard not to be loud. We got a nail gun and it works so well for it!
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Emmons

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking and durable compressor just way too loud
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how many decibels it is but it’s so loud I was in barest using it in my neighborhood so I had to return it way way too loud. However the product seems to be durable and to be able to get any job that I just couldn’t use it as it was extremely loud
customer_reviews.author: R. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking. This is a noisy compressor with no reserve.
customer_reviews.text: It makes a lot of noise for a one gallon shot of air. It takes multiple trips to fill a tire beyond 4-5 pounds of air. It really sounds like it will shake itself apart when it is filling. I gave it to my son to fill balls and opted to buy a two gallon Craftsman for about $20 more and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: kell74

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great pump for the price. Meant for around the house common uses. I use it to inflate our car tires and other inflatable items (bike, kids inflatables for pool etc) and to clear our pool lines for winter. Very efficient.
customer_reviews.author: AE

customer_reviews.title: Great tank, but really loud!!!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to read gauges, holds plenty of air for my brad nailer, inexpensive, and came with a world of different pieces for every project. Downside, this thing is LOUD (reason for 4 stars)! And it takes a bit of time for it to fill up
customer_reviews.author: Camron

customer_reviews.title: ... used it only a few times and it's worked great. Blew off the gun bench
customer_reviews.text: I've used it only a few times and it's worked great. Blew off the gun bench, aired a few tires and some other misc tasks and no issues. Yes it is loud but what compressor isn't? Best deal out there IMO since it came with an air hose, all the attachments and fittings and with prime!
customer_reviews.author: Honest Reviews

customer_reviews.title: The air in there
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for when you're feeling a little deflated. This product literally blows. I use to fill my bike tires or even top of the tires on the family vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Kristopher Compton

customer_reviews.title: Airing up tires or using a air nail gun. Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This product is great from airing up your tires all the way from buying an air nail gun to do crown molding in the house. It is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: tim alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Very loud slow air build
customer_reviews.text: This compressor doesn’t build air very fast and is louder than standing beside a interstate highway
customer_reviews.author: Mark Scott

customer_reviews.title: MISSING PARTS
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't use as missing half the parts kit!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Also it's REALLY loud and takes a good 15minutes to get to pressure!
customer_reviews.author: john smith

customer_reviews.title: Horrible don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Completely disliked this product will be returning it super loud and did not hold pressure for just a simple break fluid. Made in China crap...
customer_reviews.author: 408king

customer_reviews.title: 3-gallon air compressor does the job
customer_reviews.text: This small and inexpensive compressor performs exactly as advertised, saving my time in filling tires or footballs, etc. It comes with a very short tightly coiled hose, and an array of attachments for filling tires, footballs, etc. I bought the longer hose and a tire filling attachment to extend the usability. I'm pleased with the whole works but the compressor is very noisy, probably in the range of 100 db. Since it automatically starts itself to fill the tank, one doesn't have to be in the vicinity when it's doing that. Jim (coolmaker)
customer_reviews.author: Coolmaker

customer_reviews.title: Problem with regulator
customer_reviews.text: Capacity is fine for the PL1588 caulk gun; but the regulator doesn't work well and operates at about 55 to 60% of the setpoint. I.e., if I set the regulator to 30 pounds, when I press the trigger on the air powered caulk gun the pressure drops to 16. Set to 100 pounds, it drops to and operates at 60 pounds. I don't know if the unit is defective or normal. The 1-gallon capacity is low, and only works for specific applications.
customer_reviews.author: LegalTender

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Not for commercial use but excellent for a DYI guy like me. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use, Excellent Company.
customer_reviews.text: Good Compressor, noisy, (which all compressors are) a little slow in the building pressure range. Still, for the money, a very good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Marvallous Vernon Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Loud!
customer_reviews.text: .. works for what I needed it for (inflate pop-up camper tires at storage lot). But .. is very loud!!
customer_reviews.author: KEVIN D.

customer_reviews.title: Makes a lot of noise but produces NO pressure.
customer_reviews.text: No pressure and the warranty says I pay for shipping. I bought a working Black and Decker partially with the return shipping fee.
customer_reviews.author: coontie57

customer_reviews.title: Works alright.
customer_reviews.text: It pumps a little slow. And it's really loud. It was also missing the double male pipe adpter. And the hose line was a bit stiff.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: Abosolute piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: Extremely loud, very slow air flow and takes for-ev-er to build any pressure. Would be very surprised if it worked at all with a nail gun, maybe if you had one or two nails but certainly not for a project of any size, especially if you want to finish it in the short-term. So bad, I didn't even keep it to blow up bike tires and pool floats, wasn't worth the space it took up in my shed, plenty of room for it in my trash can though. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Barry K

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small jobs
customer_reviews.text: When an electric staple gun didn't work for my upholstery project, I bought the pneumatic one from Amazon and this little compressor to go with it. It is small and fits right on your work table. Yes, it is noisy and it needs to be turned on often to keep the pressure up. However, it provides an amazingly strong blast to drive those staples into wood, even if the cloth is bunched up. We can now easily top off our vehicle tires as well.
customer_reviews.author: LPLoveland

customer_reviews.title: TOO LOUD!
customer_reviews.text: I like the portability and light-weight. However, this thing is LOUD! You might think you're using one of those large pancake compressors when you turn it on.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Bear

customer_reviews.title: Compact and economical
customer_reviews.text: Just the right size for modest home use. Handy size and weight, has several fittings and a good but short coiled air hose. Just right for small jobs in home work shop, Pumping up bike tires, nail guns etc. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Bert R. Magnuson

customer_reviews.title: It's powerful enough to get the job done.
customer_reviews.text: The noise it's the only thing I dislike but everything else about this unit I love it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Leo C. Dean Jr

customer_reviews.title: Works well on small jobs
customer_reviews.text: The small tank pressures up to 100 psi, but it blows down in a minute or two and requires about five minutes to repressurize. I use it to occasionally clean handguns, and it works great for that and other SMALL jobs.
customer_reviews.author: James D Henry

customer_reviews.title: Air Compressor
customer_reviews.text: This air compressor is a bit too loud for me. But it was cheap; all in all it works fairly good; a bit too slow but still usable. I'll keep it for awhile then I'll buy a better one. Thanks !
customer_reviews.author: Christine Ervin

customer_reviews.title: It's a good size but my husband has nothing but issues with ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a good size but my husband has nothing but issues with the nozzle for filling:/ on top of the half hr plus it took to even get the nozzle on to the house. He's not impressed with it and I ended up buying a different one.
customer_reviews.author: Erin K. Jeltema

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Great lil compressor!! A bit noisy but for the price you can live with it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Kimball

customer_reviews.title: Good compressor from a good company!  Very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: Works just fine! A little noisy, but not really a problem. The air hose crimped as I was using it and I talked to Campbell Hausfeld and got a free replacement. Very good customer service from the manufacturer and I am pleased with the item.
customer_reviews.author: V. Pruitt

customer_reviews.title: Great value and works great.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a compressor to carry in my Motorhome. I had limited room to store it but needed something to maintain 80 PSI in the tires. This compressor meets all my needs and is very compact.
customer_reviews.author: Lonny Coffey

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade from my last CH compressor
customer_reviews.text: Good instructions, well made. Hose is really tight; hard to extend beyond a few feet. Chuck does not work well on Mercedes metal tire valves...just a bit of a struggle. Like the tank as no need for extension cord. Last CH compressor lasted at least 10 years so I am sure I'll be happy for a while.
customer_reviews.author: jgpCLS550

customer_reviews.title: Compressor to small
customer_reviews.text: This compressor is way to small for what I need. I should have gotten a bigger one. This one the Tank fills up with 110psi of air & by the time I fill up one tire the compressor comes back on. As I said I should return it & get a bigger one.
customer_reviews.author: Ranman

customer_reviews.title: Priced right.
customer_reviews.text: This compressor with the 3 gallon tank was just the right size for my usage. I had a one gallon that would not put air into my truck tires without waiting and waiting. No more waiting. I recommend it on the basis of price and product claim. It does what it is supposed to do and holds pressure over at least a week which beyond that I don't care since I use it every weekend. It is very portable and that is a big plus because my shed is on the back of the property with no electricity. That three gallon tank is all I need in reserve to add air to my lawn mower tires.
customer_reviews.author: VG

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Good item/kit for price. Good For small jobs but not very powerful and extremely noisey. Takes a long time to fill that 3 gal. Tank.
customer_reviews.author: David A. LaRiccia

customer_reviews.title: my tires need 42 psi and it handles them nicely. A nice addition to my garage
customer_reviews.text: I read some of the reviews before I purchased it and decided that it would work for me. It does! my tires need 42 psi and it handles them nicely. A nice addition to my garage. I got the 3 gallon size. I would not recommend anything smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Fontaine Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is smaller than I expected and easy to store
customer_reviews.text: I bought this compressor to replace a portable one that ran off the car battery and took forever to put a few pounds of air in a tire. Now no more trips to the gas station for air. This air compressor gets power from the house electrical outlet and fills the 100 PSI tank in about a min.. It is smaller than I expected and easy to store. Just bought one for my son to service the tires on his 4 vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: For the money can't beat it, use it around ...
customer_reviews.text: For the money can't beat it, use it around the house for bikes, balls motorcycles, really to small for much else. Maybe a Brad nailer.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J Wojo

customer_reviews.title: Not a good choice.
customer_reviews.text: Capacity tooooo small. Spray nozzle cheap and too large of an opening. Noise is unbearable.
customer_reviews.author: M. Byard

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price, little noisy
customer_reviews.text: Works great and accessories are perfect! Just a bit noisy but it is oil less so can’t really complain especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: jimbob h.

customer_reviews.title: I think I will enjoy it for other projects and small jobs around the ...
customer_reviews.text: small and convenient. I was putting in baseboards and needed a small air compressor and this fit the bill. I think I will enjoy it for other projects and small jobs around the house.
customer_reviews.author: rynsmns

customer_reviews.title: This product is not full of hot air.
customer_reviews.text: Great product for around the house chores and tire pressure. Especially when colder temperatures arrive, makes it convenient to get pumped up and your tire pressure light goes back out.
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS MERRETT

product_meta.title: Air Compressor, Portable, 3 Gallon Horizontal, Oilless, w/ 10 Piece Accessory Kit Including Air Hose & Inflation Gun (Campbell Hausfeld FP209499AV)
product_meta.description:
Style:3 gallon with inflation kit| Pattern Name:Air CompressorThe Campbell Hausfeld 3-gallon air compressor kit (FP209499AV) can handle multiple projects. This air compressor’s 3-gallon size makes it a great inflator for car tires, bike tires and sports balls; it’s also perfect for powering air brushes as well as air nailers and brad nailers to install trim, complete furniture upholstery projects and more. The conveniently placed gauges are easy to read and this air compressor’s compact design makes it easily portable. Oilless pump for maintenance-free ownership. Includes a 10-piece accessory kit so you can get started on projects right away. Operates on 120-volt household current. 110 Max PSI, 0.36 CFM at 90 PSI. Finish your projects faster and easier with Campbell Hausfeld. The Air Power Expert. Compressor duty cycle - 0.75 .

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Great for inflation, brad nailing, stapling, and air brushing. The three-gallon tank provides greater stored air power. The tank eliminates the pulsations caused by piston action. Conveniently placed gauges allow for easy monitoring of air pressure. Accessory kit includes 25-foot recoil hose, blow gun, female coupler, two inflation needles, two male plugs, air chuck, inflation adapter, tapered inflation nozzle and PTFE tape.
feature_bullets: Oil-less pump for maintenance-free ownership and strong, reliable motor output. Motor overheated
Equipped with 10 piece accessory kit which includes a coiled hose, blow gun, inflation needles and fittings.dBA @ 3ft:93
Conveniently placed gauges are easy to read & this compressor’s compact design makes it easily portable

Ideal for tire and ball inflation; it’s also perfect for powering air brushes, air/ brad nailers, upholstery projects and more. Finish your projects faster and easier with Campbell Hausfeld. The Air Power Expert
3 gallon horizontal tank and 0.36 CFM at 90 PSI. 110 Max PSI provides plenty of power to tackle DIY projects. Operates on 120 volt house outlet
